Ingredients.1: 1 (5 pound) roasting chicken, rinsed, giblets removed

Ingredients.5: 1 pinch dried rosemary, or to taste

Ingredients.6: 1 pinch dried parsley, or to taste

Directions.1: Rub chicken on all sides with salt, pepper, garlic powder, rosemary, and parsley.

Directions.2: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Saute function. Heat olive oil and add chicken, breast-side down. Cook until skin is browned, about 5 minutes. Use tongs to flip chicken and brown on the other side for another 5 minutes. Carefully remove chicken from the pot and set aside. Pour in chicken stock and deglaze the pan, scraping off all the browned bits.

Directions.3: Place the rack insert into the pot and return chicken to the pot, breast-side up. Close and lock the lid.

Directions.4: Select Poultry setting and set timer for 28 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Directions.5: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Carefully remove chicken to a carving board to rest.

Directions.6: Turn on Saute function and whisk cornstarch into the pot with the stock and drippings to make a gravy.
